definition: to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: And earlier this month, the government executed its top food-and-drug regulator after convicting him on bribery charges.
sentences.chinese: 本月初，政府因受贿罪处决了原国家药检局的局长。

sentences.english: Can non-national public servants commit the bribery crime?
sentences.chinese: 非国家工作人员可否构成受贿罪共犯？

sentences.english: The children of Kim Dae-jung and Kim Young-sam went to jail for graft.
sentences.chinese: 金大中及金泳三的孩子都曾因受贿而入狱。

sentences.english: He is so honest that he will not accept bribe.
Our problem is, bribery has become a hidden regulation of society connivance.
sentences.chinese: 我们的问题是，行贿受贿成为社会默认的潜规则。

sentences.english: The head of the county has been detained for interrogation due to corruption and bribery.
sentences.chinese: 这个县长已经因为贪污受贿而被拿问了。

sentences.english: It also contained provisions forbidding bribery and official misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 该项法律还规定，禁止行贿受贿和失职渎职行为。

sentences.english: The problem is not simply one of embezzlement and bribery.
sentences.chinese: 问题不仅仅是挪用公款和贪污受贿那么简单。

sentences.english: The grafter was haunted by the fear of being discovered.
sentences.chinese: 那个受贿人因怕被人发觉而经常提心吊胆。

sentences.english: In the past, Seongnam Three arrested in bribery because the mayor.
sentences.chinese: 过去，城南市有三位市长因为受贿被捕。

sentences.english: But his sons did not walk in his ways. They turned aside after dishonest gain and accepted bribes and perverted justice.
sentences.chinese: 他儿子不行他的道，贪图财利，收受贿赂，屈枉正直。

sentences.english: What by bribe, and what by extortions, he made enormous sums of money.
sentences.chinese: 他又受贿，又敲诈，因而有了很多钱。

sentences.english: And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.
sentences.chinese: 他儿子不行他的道，贪图财利，收受贿赂，屈枉正直。

sentences.english: To gain influence over or corrupt by bribery.
sentences.chinese: 至于易欺，那是比受贿还坏的。

sentences.english: French recipients included a former ambassador to the United Nations.
sentences.chinese: 法国的受贿者中包括一名前驻联合国大使。

sentences.english: The congressman resigned after having been found guilty of bribery.
sentences.chinese: 此议员被证明犯有行贿受贿罪后辞职了。

definition: to exact bribes/to solicit bribes/to demand bribes/to extort
to bend the law in order to favor one's relatives or associates (idiom)
corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
to use one's position for personal gain (idiom)
